title: West Ham eye move for Pablo Zabaleta if Manchester City fail to offer defender new deal
text:

West Ham will step in and offer Bacary Sagna and Pablo Zabaleta a new home at the Olympic Stadium – if no contract offer is forthcoming from Manchester City . 
The Hammers have been alerted to the potential availability of the duo as their contract negotiations at the Etihad have hit the buffers. 
Both players might be the wrong side of 30, but West Ham have the trump card of a base in the capital that will appeal to the defenders. 
City boss Pep Guardiola has challenged the pair to prove themselves flexible enough to warrant fresh deals. But so far there has been little movement and Slaven Bilic could use both full-backs in his defence. Sagna is another target for the Hammers (Photo: Getty) 
And the fact they are available on free transfers would enable the club to get near their sky-high wages at the Etihad. 
Hammers boss Bilic has been rocked by a long-term injury to Sam Byram and needs cover on the right-hand side of his defence. 
As he has played a three-man rearguard in past weeks, he would be able to accommodate Sagna and Zabaleta – despite the fact they have been rivals for the right-back berth in Manchester. poll loading Are West Ham 'too good' to go down? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
